page.title: 17Lympstone"Village-in-Bloom"
page.content: Total involvement by the villagers has made Lympstone a "joy to behold";plants flow from every crevice.The community spirit that has swept through the village,involving all ages,is evident. The play-groups,school-children,Guides& Brownies,Scouts&Cubs,Youth Club,three Churches,shops,inns,private&council gardens&the Royal Marine Estate all played a part.Cottages without gardens added colour with window boxes&tubs cascading onto lanes and slipways. Cutting branches&nettles,sweeping leaves and hoeing weeds have equally been dealt with.The village accepts the hard-work as they try to fulfill the aims of the competition-to bring colour to our towns.When tourists come and admire our efforts,we are well rewarded. Written by Mrs Enid McIlveen (Chairman of Lympstone-in-Bloom 1973-85).
